prosecutionAuthorityCode.description: The code of the prosecuting authority for the case in question

prosecutionCaseReference.description: The reference (PRN or URN)for the case in question

originator.description: Used for correlation purposes.  A short string sent by the originator and expected on the responding public event so that the orinator may understand if the response is for a request that they originated

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the request. Duplicate requests will not be processed by GoB.  ATCM set this to caseId but CC will need to set to the order id as there may be multiple impositions per case

imposingCourt.description: The code for the imposing court required in the calculation of the enforcing court

title.description: The defendants title.  If the defendant is a company this must be set to Co

surname.description: Surname/last name/family name of the defendant. Mandatory when the defendant is a person

forenames.description: Space separated list of forenames/given names.  Only relevant when the defendant is a person

dateOfBirth.description: The defendants date of birth.  Only relevant when the defendant is a person

companyName.description: When the defendant is a company, the name of the company.  Mandatory when title is Co

address1.description: Defendant address line 1, applicable to person and company defendants

address2.description: Defendant address line 2, applicable to person and company defendants

address3.description: Defendant address line 3, applicable to person and company defendants

address4.description: Defendant address line 4, applicable to person and company defendants

address5.description: Defendant address line 5, applicable to person and company defendants

postcode.description: Defendant address post code, applicable to person and company defendants

nationalInsuranceNumber.description: Defendant’s National Insurance Number. Not mandatory but useful for C&E if a Deduct from Benefits Order has been raised. If the Fine Order includes a DBO and this is not provided C&E have to do a manual lookup.

telephoneNumberHome.description: Defendant’s home telephone number. Useful for C&E if the defendant needs to be contacted regarding their Fine account, but not mandatory. Must only contain numbers, spaces and hyphens.

telephoneNumberBusiness.description: Defendant’s business telephone number. Useful for C&E if the defendant needs to be contacted regarding their Fine account, but not mandatory. Must only contain numbers, spaces and hyphens.  Mostly applicable to company defendants

telephoneNumberMobile.description: Defendant’s mobile telephone number. Useful for C&E if the defendant needs to be contacted regarding their Fine account, but not mandatory. Must only contain numbers, spaces and hyphens.

emailAddress1.description: Defendant’s email address. Useful for C&E if the defendant needs to be contacted regarding their Fine account, but not mandatory.

emailAddress2.description: Defendant’s alternate email address. Useful for C&E if the defendant needs to be contacted regarding their Fine account, but not mandatory.

dateOfSentence.description: The date of that the financial imposition was ordered

statementOfMeansProvided.description: Indicates if an MC100 has been provided

weeklyIncome.description: The defendants stated weekly income.  Applicable to SJS

benefitsTypes.description: The types of benefits that are claimed by the defendant and provided via the statement of means.

collectionOrder.description: When the imposition is a collection, the details about the type of collection

isApplicationForBenefitsDeduction.description: Indicates that the imposition is a collection order for benefits deduction

isAttachmentOfEarnings.description: Indicates that the imposition is a collection order for attachment from earnings

isCollectionOrderMade.description: Indicates that collection order result was made in court

reserveTermsType.description: The type of reserve terms. Reserve Terms Lump sum - RLSUM, Reserve Terms Lump sum plus instalments - RLSUMI, Reserve Terms Instalments only - RINSTL

paymentTermsType.description: An enumerated string that categorises the type of payment terms that have been made on the financial imposition.  BD - ByDate. This is used where the payment is supposed to be made by lump sum by specified date,  WK - Payments is made in weekly instalments,  FN - Payments is made in fortnightly instalments. MO - Monthly instalments, WL - Payments is made in weekly instalments following by lump sum, FL - fortnightly instalments + lump sum, ML - monthly instalments + lump sum, PD - Paid - not used by ATCM.

payByDate.description: The date by which the sum must be paid

lumpSumAmount.description: When payment is by lump sum, the amount that must be paid

instalmentAmount.description: When payment is by instalments, the amount that must be paid for each instalment

instalmentStartDate.description: When payment is by instalments, the date of the instalment

parentGuardianToPay.description: Not currently used. Included for future use when Youth cases are supported. Always false.

defaultDaysInJail.description: The ordered imprisonment days that will be invoked in the event of a default

employerReference.description: Reference used by the employer (e.g. payroll number) to identify the defendant.

includesOnline.description: Indicates whether the defendant submitted a Financial Means document (MC100). Not currently used by C&E but sent by ATCM.

includesGuilty.description: Indicates whether the defendant actively pled guilty to any of the offences. This is used by C&E to prove the defendant has interacted with the process in cases where they deny knowledge of the case, judgement or fine.

offenceCode.description: Identifier of the original offence type.

impositionResultCode.description: Identifier of the imposition raised against the offence. Must be FCOMP, FVS, FCOST, FCPC, FO, FVEBD, FCC.

prosecutionAuthorityId.description: If this imposition is to be paid to a third party (e.g. TFL) this identifies the third party to be paid and must be provided

majorCreditor.description: The code of the major creditor from the resulting process.
